title.rendered: Community Cloud Use Cases at the Calgary User Group

content.rendered:
Calgary User Group: Community Cloud Use Cases
May 5, 2020Calgary Admin User Group


Panaya Presents The Calgary Canada Admin Group: Community Cloud Use Cases
You aren’t misreading this one’s date, Cinco de Mayo 2020 was a double header for me.I was so grateful to both Pnaya for their morning event, and my amazing Ohana, friend, and User Group Leader Jordan Ostapiuk for the invite to present on Community Cloud for the Calgary Group May 5, 2020 as well.Jordan and I reviewed a number of Options on what to have me present on, and eventually decided that use cases for Community Cloud would be a great option.He was absolutly spot on with that choice.
Jordan not only runs the Calgary Admin group, but he also runs Banff Dreamin, an amazing Community run Salesforce event in Canada. Banff Dreamin was cancelled in 2019 and in 2020 it was postponed due to COVID 20 November, and fingers crossed we can all still go.Personally I am extrememly excited about this event, I have been watching the efforts that Jordan has gone to since the start, and just so you all know, he as put so much heart and soul and in slf into this event, it will be an Ohana dream come true.Not to mention, he has it taking place at a resort in Banff that looks like Hogwarts or a Disney Princess/Prince castle!! I can’t wait to be there!!
Back to the May 5, 2020 presentation… We went over Community Cloud use cases for Partner, Customer, and unauthenticated Communities; reviewing different ways you can use Communities from submitting Leads and Opportunities, Self Service help portals, sharing content and more! Learn about how others use Community Cloud to connect, build their brand and better relationships; inspiring you to see the infinite possibilities for you and your Community.
We had great questions through out the presentation, live demos – always fun and dangerouos, that went smoothly, and before I presented, we took time to tlak about options for keeping up on your Salesforce education and staying connected during shelter in place, which are 2 very important things at this time. If you see someone feeling down, now or at anytime, reach out – say hi, se how they are.That small action could make all the difference in the world.

The Presenters



Meighan Brodkey

Practice Manager/Technical ArchitectMeighan is a technical architect and the leader of the Seattle Women in Tech User Group leader. With over 450 Trailhead badges, Meighan is continuously working on increasing her Salesforce knowledge and helping others do so as well. She is working on becoming a Certified Technical Architect currently. She has spoken around the world about Salesforce.  She gives back to the community via Events, Twitter, the Trailblazer Community, OhanaSlack, her User Group and blog.

Meighan’s LinkedIn

Resources

jetpack-related-posts.title: Vancouver User Group: Become a Community Cloud Security Expert
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Join me to talk Community Cloud security from scratch or audit your existing. We’ll review how to setup sharing sets, account relationships, channel programs, Apex sharing, profiles, and licenses. Better how the types of sharing work together, how to decide when to use each, and best practices for implementing a…
